# OSLogType

**Structure**

The various log levels that the unified logging system provides.

## Declaration

```swift
struct OSLogType
```

## Overview

A log level controls how and when the system writes a message to the unified logging system. To write a message with a specific log level, create a [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/Logger] and call its [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/Logger/log(level:_:)] method. Alternatively, call the method that corresponds to the desired log level, such as [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/Logger/debug(_:)] or [doc://com.apple.os/documentation/os/Logger/fault(_:)].

## Getting Log Types

- **debug**: The debug log level.
- **info**: The informative log level.
- **default**: The default log level.
- **error**: The error log level.
- **fault**: The fault log level.

## Creating a Log Type

- **init(_:)**: Creates a log type from the specified value.
- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a log type from the specified raw value.

## Getting the Raw Value

- **rawValue**: The log type’s raw value.

## Log Messages

- **Logger**: An object for writing interpolated string messages to the unified logging system.
- **Message Argument Formatters**: Manage the privacy and presentation of the message’s interpolated values using type-aware formatters.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
